page.title: 12BAGGERTON RESERVOIR : ONE
page.content: F2B32 BAGGERTON RESERVOIR IS SITUATED {3.5 }KILOMETRES NORTH OF FORFAR ON BAGGERTON FARM.IT WAS BUILT BY FORFAR TOWN COUNCIL IN{1905}AND DESIGNED BY A GLASGOW FIRM CALLED BAPTI,SHAW AND MORTON. THE RESERVOIR,WHICH CAN HOLD{6820} CUBIC METRES OR{1.5}GALLONS OF WATER WHEN FULL,WOULD HAVE COST ABOUT{Â£1000 TO BUILD ORIGINALLY BUT THE COST OF THAT SAME RESERVOIR IN THE{1980'S}IS LIKELY TO BE IN THE REGION 0F{Â£350 {000. { } THE WATER ORIGINALLY CAME FROM DEN OF OGIL BUT NOW IT COMES FROM LINTRATHEN BACK WATER, AND IS BROUGHT, BY GRAVITY, THROUGH PIPE LINE TO BAGGERTON RESERVOIR. { 1.2}MILLON GALLONS OR{5700}CUBIC METRES SUPPLIES{90%}OF FORFAR AND SURROUNDING FARMS EACH DAY.
